website_summaries.verdict: The Merrell All Out Charge is a neutral running shoe that performs well on trail runs. It provides a great ground feel and will not disappoint when used on the rough trail. Based on the user reviews, the shoe gained generally positive feedback. This shoe is the best option for those who are looking for a lightweight stability shoe.
pros: Most runners were happy with this shoe being lightweight, flexible and comfortable
The HyperWrap 360 Degrees Fit System technology of the Merrell All Out Charge keeps the foot in place for agility and natural stability
The All Out Charge has a good fit as cited in some reviews
Some runners pointed out the cushioning and support of this shoe, which are exceptional
Several color variations to choose from
cons: The All Out Charge is too narrow for some runners as indicated in some reviews

customer_reviews.title: A very comfortable fit giving a very comfortable run
customer_reviews.text: A very comfortable fit giving a very comfortable run. Nice cushioning on the sole which stops impact, and good grip soles for muddy tracks. I recently wore these for The Major's Amphibious Assault Course, so a lot of the time they were in rivers or deep in mud and they performed superbly. Had a very stable grip throughout the obstacle course.
customer_reviews.author: Mr James

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: These were purchased for my day to day job (property maintenance). I was originally going to get something cheap and cheerful until it was pointed out that I am on my feet for up to 12 hours a day. I am really enjoying them and they feel comfortable and supportive. I have to say that they really do look good too although I will temper that with the fact that I am the wrong side of 50!! The 50year old says they are practical and robust!!
customer_reviews.author: skip66

customer_reviews.title: Awkward fit - not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed as the first time I used these in rain was after the return window closed so I am stuck with them The shoes are tight around the arch causing some discomfort They slip on damp/wet granite They are not waterproof, and the mesh design actually holds quite a bit of water exacerbating the issue Not convinced these are gore-tex at all
customer_reviews.author: Osevon

customer_reviews.title: Too Narrow
customer_reviews.text: You cant complain about the quality and look of merrell shoes from my experience but, this particular one, turned out too narrow for my feet cause I'm flat footed. Even when I convince myself I can wear it, Its just not safe cause it prevents blood flow cause of the curve inner side of the shoe. The shoe is still there unused and Ive not been able to sell it.
customer_reviews.author: Chuks

customer_reviews.title: Narrowest Trainer Ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: Don't let anyone tell you these are wide fitting because they're not, I couldn't even get my foot in them. It's a shame though because they look smart in black & silver. Returned for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Verified Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great in good weather
customer_reviews.text: I've run over 100 miles in them now and they'er very comfortable, I like the colour. The only problem is that they're not made for bad weather. The laces do not have much friction when wet and so come loose (though obviously they can be replaced). More problematic is that the soles clog up with mud and then become very slippy. This happens with all shoes, but I've had more trouble in these than most.
customer_reviews.author: J T Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise all good so far as I walk a lot and pushing ...
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy shoe. I'm a UK size 10 but opted to buy size 10.5 because they're a little snug. I imagine this is as they're a trail running shoe and need to stay on your foot! But I wanted extra room for by toes and foot altogether. Otherwise all good so far as I walk a lot and pushing down around 100kgs of weight so I need all the padding I can get!
customer_reviews.author: larryb2001

customer_reviews.title: Perfect hiking shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Comfortable shoes! Good for hiking. Went to Scotland and i could climb a very muddy hill without slipping, stepped in multiple puddles, walked in rain and the water stays out. The shoes seem thick and are heavier then I'm use to, but they keep my feet warm and dry!
customer_reviews.author: karlis

customer_reviews.title: Great support trail shoe with lots of feel and waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Merrell's for decades but never run in them before. I bought my first pair of these 7 months ago and have covered 1000km in them with no complaints. Really great shoes for flat feet over pronator that still wants to feel the trail. I have now upgraded to the GTX version and it is a revelation to be waterproof. I ran through a massive puddle about 6-8 inches deep and with a bit of high-stepping to stop it overflowing the top, iI came out with completely dry and warm feet. Well worth the extra cash. the only complaint is that the grip is not good in slippery mud, but the are great on rocky trails.
customer_reviews.author: A Farquhar

customer_reviews.title: gave me some good calf pains before I realized this shoe is not ...
customer_reviews.text: Some of the glued decorations peeled off after a few weeks. the shoe does not provide enough protection against sharp stones from the sides nor the sole. what a disaster, bought as a support shoe for trail running. this is NOT a support shoe. this is a moderate stack neutral shoe. gave me some good calf pains before I realized this shoe is not for me It looks pale and much less attractive in real life compared to the picture. I am disappointed with this shoe
customer_reviews.author: Yoel

customer_reviews.title: Normal fit
customer_reviews.text: Reading the reviews I was worried about the sizing coming up narrow. Well, I'm a 9.5 in various versions of Asics GT 1000 & 2000 and these fit perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.author: S.T

customer_reviews.title: The grip on the bottom of the shoe is really good! Some may think it's a expensive price but ...
customer_reviews.text: So comfy and work really well. The grip on the bottom of the shoe is really good! Some may think it's a expensive price but it's well worth it! I've worn them in all weathers and have had no problems
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loved them
customer_reviews.text: Really liked these shoes, I was looking to get another pair but can't get them anymore.
customer_reviews.author: NK

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe. Discounted but still pricey. Fits nicely, looks and functions well though.
customer_reviews.author: Shoppiegalore

customer_reviews.title: Love the shoe usually but...
customer_reviews.text: Have bought several pairs of the all out charge and love the shoe; unfortunately the latest pair I purchased don't seem to be as durable as previous ones. The ankle support eyelet has ripped in about a month, meaning you can no-longer lock in the heel which really reduces the stability. Fingers crossed this is only a weakness in this batch and not something systematic
customer_reviews.author: jack jervoise

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have had this shoe for a year. It's a very good running shoe and offers lots of surport. A good neutral shoe
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: and it proved to be a good decision! I maintained a faster pace and my ...
customer_reviews.text: I went with trail runners rather than heavy hiking boots on a long hike, and it proved to be a good decision! I maintained a faster pace and my feet didn't get tired. No blisters, too!
customer_reviews.author: Jason D.

customer_reviews.title: Very! very!! Nice traner
customer_reviews.text: I always go to Merrell, am a Fan, always nice fit.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable at a good price
customer_reviews.text: I saw these shoes as a well-priced entry into several "top 10 trail running shoes" lists so I decided to get them. They're very comfortable and durable; also relatively attractive too. I've been on a few jogs already with these shoes; my legs ache less and my ankles aren't in discomfort anymore. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: thequickbrownfox

customer_reviews.title: A perfect, lightweight and responsive trail runner
customer_reviews.text: A perfect, lightweight and responsive trail runner. Good support and grip. Good cushion despite low to the ground feel. Typical merrell quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J. A. Burton

customer_reviews.title: three months on and lots of gym and cycling later these shoes are still great. Usual high quality Merrell product
customer_reviews.text: Lovely all round running and training a shoes, three months on and lots of gym and cycling later these shoes are still great. Usual high quality Merrell product.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Pitman

customer_reviews.title: All rounders
customer_reviews.text: I run roads, trails, climb mountains in these and they are incredibly strong, durable and versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Morton

customer_reviews.title: Nice trainers
customer_reviews.text: More orange than red but very comfortable and very stable
customer_reviews.author: jay

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good. Comfortable, good grip, resistant. Great satisfaction, Bought 3 numbers above. my size for long trail running.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Vasconcelos

customer_reviews.title: Allround shoes for trail running
customer_reviews.text: A really nice shoe for trail running. If you like the Merrell Bare Access 4 and are on the hunt for a nice trail shoes this one probably will fit the bill. Same sizeing as Bare Access.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Ekman

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Fits great, lightweight, robus, somewhat waterproof,but over all very happy so far with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good running shoes
customer_reviews.text: had them a few weeks and love em nice to run in and really love that the tong is stitched to one side so its always in perfect placement
customer_reviews.author: Nicolaj Munk Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Poor
customer_reviews.text: Instep was far too high, felt as though there was a large pebble inside the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: A well made, trail running shoe. These are ...
customer_reviews.text: A well made, trail running shoe. These are considerably stronger than an ordinary trainer/running shoe and slightly heavier too.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great price (daily deal) and they fit really well - I have a wide foot so was pleased they are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd pair of these shoes, first pair still going strong after 500 miles mostly off road but also use them in 10ks on the road, best running shoes I have had terrific value.
customer_reviews.author: mr m margison

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, light, good for trails
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, one of its first outings was a 23km trail run up snowdon, the shoes held up well. Nice and light, grippy and comfy
customer_reviews.author: ADs

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy and good grip to date
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy and good grip to date. Not so great in deep mud but as expected. Good on mixed terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Kearney

customer_reviews.title: Shoes that fit like gloves
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. Great colour. Arrived 2 days earlier than expected. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Ruaraidh johnston

customer_reviews.title: Slippy when wet
customer_reviews.text: Nice trainer very comfy. Can be slippy on wet paths but i find this with most trail trainers.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle jones

customer_reviews.title: after only a few weeks there was noticeable wear on the inside on the shoe so not very happy with product overall - i wouldn't buy this model
customer_reviews.text: fitted well, which surprised me as some Merrell Goretex shoes are too tight and you need a larger size. However, after only a few weeks there was noticeable wear on the inside on the shoe so not very happy with product overall - i wouldn't buy this model again
customer_reviews.author: chris c

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: fits well and very comfortable. I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: sbk

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good fit but only lasted 4 months before front toe protection started to split.
customer_reviews.author: ch

customer_reviews.title: Superb Buy
customer_reviews.text: Great trainers. For someone like me, with flat feet through years in the Army, these are absolutely fantastic. Great trainer and so comfortable at a fabulous price.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Patten

customer_reviews.title: Good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Used them this morning and felt great on feet when running. Never had Ferrell running shoes before but 1st impressions are good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Only problem is you need buy slightly larger than your number. Half number will be enough .
customer_reviews.author: KIAI

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: very comfy good fit very good quality very lightweight great for sports and everyday use really like them
customer_reviews.author: doctorsnurses

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My partner is very happy with the trainers, lovely colours and fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Dionne

customer_reviews.title: Not fit for purpose
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed that within 2 months these shoes have split and are letting water in
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: An excellent pair of running trainers, Extremely comfortable and feel very supportive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price too
customer_reviews.text: Quality trainer with comfy snug fit as per my previous pair. Excellent price too.
customer_reviews.author: IB

customer_reviews.title: So Happy!
customer_reviews.text: These are so comfy and look great! Seem to be made to last also!
customer_reviews.author: john welton

customer_reviews.title: A comfortable and good shoe I may call in the future ...
customer_reviews.text: A comfortable and good shoe I may call in the future my problem that the price of shipping to Israel is high
customer_reviews.author: Moshe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable this is my 3rd purchase of Merrell shoes and I look forward to the next.
customer_reviews.author: Terence Miller

customer_reviews.title: ... out for one 16km hike but the comfort was excellent. Grip was good too
customer_reviews.text: I've only had these out for one 16km hike but the comfort was excellent. Grip was good too.
customer_reviews.author: T J J Johnson

customer_reviews.title: 5 Came out more like UK
customer_reviews.text: Down as UK 11 US 11.5 Came out more like UK 10
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous shoe
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic shoe! Looks and feels great. Very comfortable and robust at same time
customer_reviews.author: David Harrison

customer_reviews.title: These are very good shoes. However
customer_reviews.text: These are very good shoes. However, I don't love these as much as my Merrell pace gloves, which are very minimalist. These are light (though not as light as the pace gloves because they offer more protection) and comfortable. They provide more cushioning than the pace gloves, so are better over longer distances, but not as light, or as gait friendly. Also, I don't love the neon colours (despite them being fashionable). I would have liked grey/black, but these weren't available.
customer_reviews.author: Pots

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for tearing around the woods
customer_reviews.text: Decent trail shoes which handle rocky trails with ease, as well as wet grass. Probably not up to really deep mud as tread is fairly shallow. Very comfortable but had to buy half a size larger as they came up small. I am a fairly heavy runner and these offer fairly little in the way of cushioning but on softer ground this is not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Chippy87

customer_reviews.title: Not for wide feet!
customer_reviews.text: I would give 5 stars if I had very narrow feet, but unfortunatly I have to wear a support on my left ankle so I had to send them back. You can't open shoe widely as the toung is fitted all the way up.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: its very good fit and very comfortable for lomg walks too
customer_reviews.text: Merrell has not failed me, its very good fit and very comfortable for lomg walks too. Highly recommend this pair.
customer_reviews.author: Denzil Fernando

customer_reviews.title: Poor grip and mud shedding for a trail shoe
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 pairs of these, tried them last weekend on the South Downs and was really disappointed with them. They are sold as trail shoes but had no traction and grip in slightly damp conditions. Also that the mud clung to the bottom of the shoes and therefore were not designed to shed mud at all. I ended up getting taller with more mud being added to the bottom of the shoes and the little traction/grip there was nullified be even more mud. Please don't buy these shoes for changing/challenging conditions there are much better options on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Merrell Men's All Out Charge Trail Running Shoes
product_meta.description: These All Out Charge shoes from Merrell feature mesh upper and reflective details for increased visibility in low light. Impact-responsive Unifly cushioning underfoot gives you sensitivity and connection to the ground for better control, while offering a protective buffer to smooth out pointy rocks and roots.
feature_bullets: Mesh Upper - Ensures breathability to keep the feet feeling cool and dry.
HyperWrap 360 Degrees Fit System - Locks the foot in place to enhance natural stability and agility.
Reflective Detailing - Provides increased visibility in low light conditions.
M Select FRESH Removable Footbed - Naturally eliminates sweat and its odour-causing bacteria.
UniFly Midsole - Disperses impact and stabilizes for a solid takeoff.
